data.title: Good standard fair
data.text: I continually believe - although this is great standard food at the Grand Cafe (and fantastic egg rolls). The interior needs an upgrade. I will be back. It is a regular stop and service is usually more than adequate and pleasant.  :)

data.title: Excellent Food @ an Excellent Price
data.text: People that leave bad revues are just rival, jealous businesses. The Grand Cafe is Terrific. Plenty of food & it is so great!!!

data.title: Egg Rolls!
data.text: Best egg rolls we've ever had anywhere! Long time family owned place, that's not fancy but good food & good wait staff.

data.title: Yuck!
data.text: All I can say is Yuck!  I had heard some many good things about this place.  I looks cool from the outside.  First question, Where are you suppose to park?  The place looked ok when we went inside, but the food was nasty, the dishes they served it on was nasty.  I was shocked.

data.title: Not what it once was
data.text: They have the best egg rolls I've ever had to this day.  Good variety of food and its usually good.  Service is usually good as well. Egg Foo Yung is a favorite of mine.

data.title: Not as good as usual!
data.text: The service was good and fast even though it was Mother's Day.  The food seemed to be cooked ahead and kept hot.  The Chow Mein bean sprouts were limp and not crisp like usual.  The Sweet and Sour shrimp had more breading than shrimp.

data.title: Favorite place for Chinese
data.text: We celebrate a lot of family occasions there. Love the food and the staff.We also use the take out and delivery. Food always hot when delivered.

data.title: Predicatably good
data.text: Been going to this same restaurant since I arrived in town in 1970. Pretty much the same recipes with the same outcomes. Very good.

data.title: hANDS DOWN, THE MOST AUTHENTIC CHINESE CUISINE!
data.text: CONVENIENTLY located at the heart of Bloomington, IL , this  place have been excellent for the past 16 years I had the pleasure eating there.  Cooked to order meals, fresh, low fat and sodium.    It is more expensive than a  middle of the road Chinese buffet (which it is NOT!), but  one would really enjoy  lunch or dinner  there , for a special occasion or for a casual dinner with friends or family.

data.title: Not grand at all
data.text: Ugh. Flavorless food. Steamed dumpling that were fried. Not recommended if you want good Chinese. But on the flip side. You can also get fried chicken!

data.title: Best Chinese food in Blomington/Normal
data.text: Other Chinese restaurants have come and gone but this remains a favorite.  The interior of the restaurant itself is showing signs of wear and tear but since they began offering delivery, we seldom eat there anymore.  They are always very accommodating when we ask for no MSG or to make a dish vegan friendly.

data.title: best chinese in town
data.text: best best best Chinese food in town--EVERYTHING is awesome and the value is phenomenal. Our entire family loves this restaurant

data.title: The eggrolls here are the BEST!!!!!
data.text: We love to get take out from Grand Café.  They have fantastic fried rice and the eggrolls are beyond compare.  Don't come to Bloomington without trying Grand Café!

data.title: Good and Inexpensive
data.text: Not much to look at but worth trying at least once. We had the Thursday special which includes an appetizer, soup and a main dish with side for $8.95.  It was much more food than we could eat but it was all good.  There is free parking in front and behind the restaurant.

data.title: Great family Chinese restaurant with consistently good food and excellent service. Best egg rolls in the world, too.
data.text:
I've been eating at the Grand Cafe ever since my parents moved us to Bloomington Normal back in 1976.  The food has always been good.  The servers and other wait-staff are super friendly and treat everyone like family.  I believe this restaurant's owner is the 4th generation that has been running the restaurant.  He is a super nice guy and still has the passion for excellence that I saw back in 1976 from the previous generation.  

I won't say that the Grand has the best Chinese food in the world...it is traditional Cantonese style and is excellent and consistent.  I'm sure there are fancier, more trendy, more "gourmet", groundbreaking Chinese restaurants out there.  But I like what I like, and I like their food.  

This restaurant is also a favorite of all three of my daughters.  We do date nights every week, and at least half of the time, they want to go to "the Grand Poobah" as we call it.  

Did I mention, that the prices are also extremely reasonable.  You get a ton of food, for less than most other sit-down Chinese restaurants.  And you can't beat the atmosphere.  Typical of a great Chinese place - slightly dark and dated decor, weird, outdated bathrooms, etc.  But all the best Chinese places are like this...

data.title: Great Food & Ambiance
data.text: LOVE Grand Cafe! Great food and nice ambiance! :-) Friendly staff! I love the egg drop soup there! Top notch!

data.title: a local favorite
data.text: Some of the food is good, some not so good. The do have good fried rice, but the place is a little outdated and maybe a little dirty. The locals who have been going here for generations swear by this place, maybe I need to give it more of a chance!

data.title: Chinese restaurant known for fried chicken???
data.text: I have visited this restaurant about once per year for the last 25 years.  It's part of a group banquet, not something I would do by choice.  The food is decent, and they provide good portions.  The funny thing about this local fspot is it is known for its fried chicken.  The egg rolls are better in my opinion.  They also no longer have a liquor license, so if you want a drink with dinner, you can't get it there.  Service is friendly and quick with a local crowd of regulars seeming to fuel its existance.

data.title: Try it for the eggrolls!!
data.text: I come here for the eggrolls. They are phenomenal! Everything else is fairly good. I would skip the sweet and sour though. The meat is fairly tough and too much breading. The decor is older cheesy Chinese restaurant style but the staff is always very friendly and its a family run business.

data.title: One of my favorites!
data.text: I've been going to the Grand for over 35 years! Definitely a family favorite. They have the best eggrolls I've ever had.. Hands down. Dinner for two comes with appetizers, main meal, and dessert.  Our usual consists of wonton soup, fried wontons, eggrolls, BBQ pork, chicken almond din, sweet N sour pork, fried rice, followed by almond cookies and peppermint ice cream. Always enough to take home for lunch the next day!
